there is uh there are hierarchy issues and there's specifically folks feel um a

or um where there's someone's boss in the room uh people shut down and we
acknowledged that early on as a real challenge to the work that we wanted to do because we wanted every single person
in this uh session to work and contribute their best ideas and so we
see leadership as a design challenge actually and so after the first day the three of us got together and said okay
what are we going to do to uh to affect people's behavior such that we actually
can achieve the outcomes want to achieve and we learned that um as we reflected on these particular cultural challenges
we learned that people needed to feel confident that they had time to um to
articulate a a statement that they actually believed in and our leader our style in this Workshop was just throw
people in and then say what do you think what do you think what do you think what do you think and we realized in the Asian culture that put people on the
spot and nobody likes being on the spot in front of their boss and so we did the second days we said all right we need to
change and rather than asking people what do you think and you have to respond immediately in front of the camera we said okay take two minutes
everybody write down a couple of things you think and so we honored the fact that people needed to feel a little bit
more equipped and prepared to answer a question and then what we did to make sure that everybody had a voice and felt
included we actually went around rather than asking people at random we said now we're all going to share the thing that we wrote down and so we had every single
person in the room share and what that did over time is it it gave the impression that everybody's ideas are valid that no idea was necessarily bad
